# è„šæœ¬æ ·ä¾‹

# Hello Worldï¼

#!/bin/bash
# Program:
#       This program shows "Hello World!" in your screen.
# History:
# 2021/07/13 Sinki First release

# Show name

#!/bin/bash
# Program:
# User inputs his first name and last name.  Program shows his full name.
# History:
# 2021/07/13 Sinki First release

read -p "Please input your first name: " firstname      # æç¤ºä½¿ç”¨è€…è¾“å…¥

read -p "Please input your last name:  " lastname       # æç¤ºä½¿ç”¨è€…è¾“å…¥
echo "\nYour full name is: ${firstname} ${lastname}" # ç»“æœç”±å±å¹•è¾“å‡º

# Create files

#!/bin/bash
# Program:
# Program creates three files, which named by user's input and date command.
# History:
# 2021/07/13 Sinki First release

# 1. è®©ä½¿ç”¨è€…è¾“å…¥æ–‡ä»¶åï¼Œå¹¶å–å¾— fileuser è¿™ä¸ªå˜é‡ï¼›
echo "I will use 'touch' command to create 3 files." # çº¯ç²¹æ˜¾ç¤ºä¿¡æ¯
read -p "Please input your filename: " fileuser         # æç¤ºä½¿ç”¨è€…è¾“å…¥

# 2. ä¸ºäº†é¿å…ä½¿ç”¨è€…éšæ„æŒ‰ Enter ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨å˜é‡åŠŸèƒ½åˆ†ææ¡£åæ˜¯å¦æœ‰è®¾å®šï¼Ÿ
filename=${fileuser:-"filename"}           # å¼€å§‹åˆ¤æ–­æœ‰å¦é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶å

# 3. å¼€å§‹åˆ©ç”¨ date æŒ‡ä»¤æ¥å–å¾—æ‰€éœ€è¦çš„æ¡£åäº†ï¼›
date1=$(date --date='2 days ago' +%Y%m%d)  # å‰ä¸¤å¤©çš„æ—¥æœŸ
date2=$(date --date='1 days ago' +%Y%m%d)  # å‰ä¸€å¤©çš„æ—¥æœŸ
date3=$(date +%Y%m%d)                      # ä»Šå¤©çš„æ—¥æœŸ
file1=${filename}${date1}                  # åº•ä¸‹ä¸‰è¡Œåœ¨é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶å
file2=${filename}${date2}
file3=${filename}${date3}

# 4. å°†æ¡£åå»ºç«‹å§ï¼
touch "${file1}"                           # åº•ä¸‹ä¸‰è¡Œåœ¨å»ºç«‹æ–‡ä»¶
touch "${file2}"
touch "${file3}"

# æ•´æ•°è¿ç®— $((è®¡ç®—å¼))

total=$((${firstnu}*${secnu}))

# æµ®ç‚¹è¿ç®— bc

time echo "scale=${num}; 4*a(1)" | bc -lq

# æŒ‡ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ

  1. ç›´æ¥æŒ‡ä»¤ä¸‹è¾¾ï¼š shell.sh æ–‡ä»¶å¿…é¡»è¦å…·å¤‡ (rx) æƒé™ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ç»å¯¹è·¯å¾„ï¼Œç›¸å¯¹è·¯å¾„æˆ–åœ¨ PATH ä¸­.
  2. ä»¥ bash ç¨‹åºæ¥æ‰§è¡Œï¼šé€è¿‡ã€ bash shell.sh ã€æˆ–ã€ sh shell.sh ã€æ¥æ‰§è¡Œ

å‰ä¸¤ç§æ˜¯å­ shell, å˜é‡ä¸ä¿ç•™ã€‚è€Œ source æ˜¯åœ¨å½“å‰çš„ç¯å¢ƒä¸­æ‰§è¡Œ.

# åˆ¤æ–­å¼

# test

  1. å…³äºæŸä¸ªæ¡£åçš„ã€æ–‡ä»¶ç±»å‹ã€åˆ¤æ–­ï¼Œå¦‚ test -e filename è¡¨ç¤ºå­˜åœ¨å¦
    - e è¯¥ã€æ¡£åã€æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ï¼Ÿ(å¸¸ç”¨)
    -f è¯¥ã€æ¡£åã€æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ä¸”ä¸ºæ–‡ä»¶ (file)ï¼Ÿ(å¸¸ç”¨)
    -d è¯¥ã€æ–‡ä»¶åã€æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ä¸”ä¸ºç›®å½• (directory)ï¼Ÿ(å¸¸ç”¨)
  2. å…³äºæ–‡ä»¶çš„æƒé™ä¾¦æµ‹ï¼Œå¦‚ test -r filename è¡¨ç¤ºå¯è¯»å¦ (ä½† root æƒé™å¸¸æœ‰ä¾‹å¤–)
    -r ä¾¦æµ‹è¯¥æ¡£åæ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ä¸”å…·æœ‰ã€å¯è¯»ã€çš„æƒé™ï¼Ÿ
    -w ä¾¦æµ‹è¯¥æ¡£åæ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ä¸”å…·æœ‰ã€å¯å†™ã€çš„æƒé™ï¼Ÿ
    -x ä¾¦æµ‹è¯¥æ¡£åæ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨ä¸”å…·æœ‰ã€å¯æ‰§è¡Œã€çš„æƒé™ï¼Ÿ
  3. ä¸¤ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶ä¹‹é—´çš„æ¯”è¾ƒï¼Œå¦‚ï¼š test file1 -nt file2
    -nt (newer than) åˆ¤æ–­ file1 æ˜¯å¦æ¯” file2 æ–°
    - ot (older than) åˆ¤æ–­ file1 æ˜¯å¦æ¯” file2 æ—§
    - ef åˆ¤æ–­ file1 ä¸ file2 æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºåŒä¸€æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¯ç”¨åœ¨åˆ¤æ–­ hard link çš„åˆ¤å®šä¸Šã€‚ ä¸»è¦æ„ä¹‰åœ¨åˆ¤å®šï¼Œä¸¤ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶æ˜¯å¦å‡æŒ‡å‘åŒä¸€ä¸ª inode å“©ï¼
  4. å…³äºä¸¤ä¸ªæ•´æ•°ä¹‹é—´çš„åˆ¤å®šï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ test n1 -eq n2
    -eq ä¸¤æ•°å€¼ç›¸ç­‰ (equal)
    -ne ä¸¤æ•°å€¼ä¸ç­‰ (not equal)
    -gt n1 å¤§äº n2 (greater than)
    -lt n1 å°äº n2 (less than)
    -ge n1 å¤§äºç­‰äº n2 (greater than or equal)
    -le n1 å°äºç­‰äº n2 (less than or equal)
  5. åˆ¤å®šå­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„æ•°æ®
    test -z string åˆ¤å®šå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ˜¯å¦ä¸º 0 ï¼Ÿè‹¥ string ä¸ºç©ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œåˆ™ä¸º true
    test -n string åˆ¤å®šå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ˜¯å¦éä¸º 0 ï¼Ÿè‹¥ string ä¸ºç©ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œåˆ™ä¸º falseã€‚ æ³¨ï¼š -n äº¦å¯çœç•¥
    test str1 == str2 åˆ¤å®š str1 æ˜¯å¦ç­‰äº str2 ï¼Œè‹¥ç›¸ç­‰ï¼Œåˆ™å›ä¼  true
    test str1 != str2 åˆ¤å®š str1 æ˜¯å¦ä¸ç­‰äº str2 ï¼Œè‹¥ç›¸ç­‰ï¼Œåˆ™å›ä¼  false
  6. å¤šé‡æ¡ä»¶åˆ¤å®šï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š test -r filename -a -x filename
    -a (and) ä¸¤çŠ¶å†µåŒæ—¶æˆç«‹ï¼ä¾‹å¦‚ test -r file -a -x fileï¼Œåˆ™ file åŒæ—¶å…·æœ‰ r ä¸ x æƒé™æ—¶ï¼Œæ‰å›ä¼  trueã€‚
    -o (or) ä¸¤çŠ¶å†µä»»ä½•ä¸€ä¸ªæˆç«‹ï¼ä¾‹å¦‚ test -r file -o -x fileï¼Œåˆ™ file å…·æœ‰ r æˆ– x æƒé™æ—¶ï¼Œå°±å¯å›ä¼  trueã€‚
    ! åç›¸çŠ¶æ€ï¼Œå¦‚ test ! -x file ï¼Œå½“ file ä¸å…·æœ‰ x æ—¶ï¼Œå›ä¼  true

# [ ]

æ³¢åŠ¨ä¸ä¸“é¢˜ï¼Œæœ¬è¯¾ç»“æŸã€‚

# ç¬¬ä¸ƒç« ï¼šæµ·æ´‹æ³¢åŠ¨

# æµ·æ´‹é‡åŠ›æ³¢ï¼ˆæ°´æ³¢ï¼‰

entry.title: åŒ—æ SIE/SIV è®¡ç®—
entry.content:
Arctic sea ice extent and volume (SIE and SIV).

# å®šä¹‰

Sea ice concentration is the percentage of each pixel that is covered by ice.
æµ·å†°æµ“åº¦æ˜¯æ¯ä¸ªç½‘æ ¼è¢«å†°è¦†ç›–çš„ç™¾åˆ†æ¯”ã€‚

Sea ice extent is calculated by adding up the pixels with an ice concentration of at least 15 percent.
æµ·å†°èŒƒå›´çš„è®¡ç®—æ–¹æ³•æ˜¯å°†å†°æµ“åº¦è‡³å°‘ä¸º 15% çš„ç½‘æ ¼çš„æµ·å†°é¢ç§¯ç›¸åŠ ã€‚

In each grid cell the sea ice volume is calculated as thickness multiplied with concentration and with area, with contributions from all grid cells to the total volume.
åœ¨æ¯ä¸ªç½‘æ ¼ä¸­ï¼Œæµ·å†°ä½“ç§¯è®¡ç®—ä¸ºåšåº¦ä¹˜ä»¥æµ“åº¦å’Œé¢ç§¯ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰ç½‘æ ¼å•å…ƒç´¯åŠ ä¸ºæ€»ä½“ç§¯ã€‚

Satellites measure sea ice concentration on a 25 kilometer by 25 kilometer grid. This image illustrates the area covered by each pixel of the low-resolution microwave instruments superimposed on a higher-resolution, color satellite image. (NASA Earth Observatory image by Joshua Stevens and Robert Simmon, based on MODIS data.)

å‚è€ƒï¼šNASA, sea iceï¼ŒPolar Portal, Sea Ice Thickness and Volume

# æ¨¡å¼æ•°æ®è®¡ç®—

åœ¨ sea ice model: Community Ice Code (CICE) çš„æœˆæ•°æ®è¾“å‡ºä¸­ï¼Œä¸ SIE/SIV æœ‰å…³çš„æœ‰

  • hi(m): grid cell mean ice thickness (tarea) # ice volume per unit grid cell area
  • aice(%): ice area (aggregate) (tarea)
  • hisnap(m): ice volume snapshot (tarea)
  • aisnap(): ice area snapshot (tarea)

è¿˜æœ‰ä¸€äº› aicen00x (ice volume, category 1~5)ï¼›vicen00x (ice area, category 1~5)ï¼Œä¸çŸ¥é“ç±»åˆ«å¯¹åº”çš„ç‰©ç†é‡æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Œä¼°è®¡ä¸åé¢çš„åˆ†ææœ‰å…³ã€‚

å–åŒ—çº¬ 30Â° ä»¥ä¸Šçš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œaice å¯¹åº”æµ·å†°æµ“åº¦ï¼Œç­›å»å°äº 15% çš„æ•°æ®åä¹˜ä»¥ T ç½‘æ ¼é¢ç§¯ç´¯åŠ è®¡ç®—æµ·å†°èŒƒå›´ï¼›
hi ä¸ºç½‘æ ¼å¹³å‡å†°åšï¼Œä¹˜ä»¥ T ç½‘æ ¼é¢ç§¯ç´¯åŠ è®¡ç®—æµ·å†°ä½“ç§¯ã€‚

å¯¹æ¯å¹´çš„ 12 æœˆæ•°æ®å–å¹³å‡è®¡ç®—å½“å¹´çš„ SIE/SIVï¼Œç»˜åˆ¶æ¨¡å‹ 37 å¹´çš„è¾“å‡ºç»“æœã€‚

å¯¹æ¯æœˆçš„ 33 è‡³ 37 å…± 5 æ¨¡å‹å¹´çš„æ•°æ®å–å¹³å‡ï¼Œè®¡ç®— SIE/SIV çš„æ°”å€™å­£èŠ‚å¾ªç¯ï¼Œä¸”ä½“ç§¯ä¸ PIOMASï¼ˆ1979-2002ï¼‰å®é™…æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œæ¯”è¾ƒã€‚

å¯¹åº”ä»£ç ï¼š

parfor i = 1:n
    FileName=fileName{i};
    start=[1,1,1];count=[Inf,Inf,1];stride=[1,1,1];
    iceAreaAve=ncread(FileName,'aice',start,count,stride)*0.01;
    iceVolumeAve=ncread(FileName,'hi',start,count,stride);
    iceAreaAve(iceAreaAve<0.15)=NaN;
    iceArea(i)=nansum(nansum(iceAreaAve.*tarea));
    iceVolume(i)=nansum(nansum(iceVolumeAve.*tarea));
end

# åŒ—ææ¶›åŠ¨

åŒ—ææ¶›åŠ¨ï¼ˆAOï¼‰æ˜¯æŒ‡åŒ—åŠçƒä¸­çº¬åº¦åœ°åŒºï¼ˆçº¦åŒ—çº¬ 45 åº¦ï¼‰ä¸åŒ—æåœ°åŒºæ°”å‹å½¢åŠ¿å·®åˆ«çš„å˜åŒ–ã€‚å®ƒæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä»£è¡¨åŒ—æåœ°åŒºå¤§æ°”ç¯æµçš„é‡è¦æ°”å€™æŒ‡æ•°ï¼Œå¯åˆ†ä¸ºæ­£ä½ç›¸å’Œè´Ÿä½ç›¸ã€‚

åŒ—æé€šå¸¸å—ä½æ°”å‹ç³»ç»Ÿæ”¯é…ï¼Œè€Œé«˜æ°”å‹ç³»ç»Ÿåˆ™ä½äºä¸­çº¬åº¦åœ°åŒºã€‚å½“ AO å¤„äºæ­£ä½ç›¸æ—¶ï¼Œè¿™äº›ç³»ç»Ÿçš„æ°”å‹å·®è¾ƒæ­£å¸¸å¼ºï¼Œå›´ç»•åŒ—æçš„ä¸€åœˆå¼ºé£å°†å¯’å†·çš„ç©ºæ°”é™åˆ¶åœ¨æåœ°åœ°åŒºï¼Œé™åˆ¶äº†æåŒºå†·ç©ºæ°”å‘å—æ‰©å±•ï¼›å½“ AO å¤„äºè´Ÿä½ç›¸æ—¶ï¼Œè¿™äº›ç³»ç»Ÿçš„æ°”å‹å·®è¾ƒæ­£å¸¸å¼±ï¼Œè¿™æ¡é£å¸¦å˜å¾—æ›´å¼±ã€æ›´æ‰­æ›²ï¼Œå†·ç©ºæ°”è¾ƒæ˜“å‘å—ä¾µè¢­ï¼Œå¹¶å¢åŠ äº†è¿›å…¥ä¸­çº¬åº¦åœ°åŒºçš„é£æš´ã€‚

AO æŒ‡æ•°æ˜¯é€šè¿‡å°† AO è´Ÿè·æ¨¡å¼æŠ•å½±åˆ°åŒ—çº¬ 20 åº¦ä»¥åŒ—çš„æ—¥å¼‚å¸¸ 1000 æ¯«å·´é«˜åº¦åœºè€Œè·å¾—çš„ã€‚åˆ©ç”¨å¤šå¹´æœˆå¹³å‡æ•°æ®ï¼Œé€‰æ‹© AO åŠ è½½æ¨¡å¼ä½œä¸º EOF åˆ†æçš„ä¸»æ¨¡æ€ã€‚
AO æŒ‡æ•°æ˜¯å…³äºåŒ—çº¬ 20 åº¦ä»¥åŒ—æµ·å¹³é¢æ°”å‹çš„éå­£èŠ‚æ€§å˜åŒ–çš„ä¸»æ¨¡æ€çš„åºåˆ—ï¼Œå…¶è®¡ç®—æ¶‰åŠåˆ° EOF åˆ†æï¼ˆEmpirical Orthogonal Function analysisï¼‰ã€‚

# EOF åˆ†æ

# ç½‘æ ¼

# B-grid

CSIM uses a generalized orthogonal B-grid, where tracer quantities are located at the center of the grid cells, and velocities are located at the corners. The internal ice stress tensor takes four different values within a grid cell. Tracer quantities in the ice model include ice and snow area, volume, energy and temperature. The grid comprised of the center points of the grid cells is referred to as the â€œT gridâ€. The â€œU gridâ€ is comprised of the ponts at the northeast corner of the corresponding cell on the T grid. Quantities that are defined on the U grid include ice and ocean dynamics variables.

è®¡ç®—åº”å˜é€Ÿç‡æ‰€éœ€è¦çš„é€Ÿåº¦æ˜¯å®šä¹‰åœ¨ U grid ä¸Šçš„ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯æ¯ä¸ª cell çš„ä¸œåŒ—è§’ã€‚è®ºæ–‡ä¸­ç½‘æ ¼ä¸ºnin_iniâ€‹ è¡Œnjn_jnjâ€‹ åˆ—ï¼Œå³ç«¯æ˜¯é«˜çº¬åœ°åŒºã€‚

# æ—‹è½¬

åœ¨æˆªå–äº†é«˜çº¬åœ°åŒº nj*5/7 : nj åˆ—åï¼Œå°†ä¸‹åŠéƒ¨åˆ†æ—‹è½¬åˆ°å³ç«¯æ‹¼æ¥æµ·æ´‹ã€‚

% æ›´æ–°ç»´åº¦ä¸ºæˆªå–åŒ—æå
nj = size(uVel,2);

% æŠŠä¸‹åŠæ•°æ®æ—‹è½¬åˆ°å³è¾¹
u = [ uVel([ni,1:ni/2],1:nj), -uVel(ni:-1:ni/2,nj-1:-1:1) ];
v = [ vVel([ni,1:ni/2],1:nj), -vVel(ni:-1:ni/2,nj-1:-1:1) ];

% æ—‹è½¬åçš„ç½‘æ ¼å»æ‰è¥¿è¾¹ç•Œå’Œå—è¾¹ç•Œ
lat = [lat(1:ni/2,2:nj),   lat(ni-1:-1:ni/2,nj-1:-1:1) ];
lon = [lon(1:ni/2,2:nj),   lon(ni-1:-1:ni/2,nj-1:-1:1) ];

dx = [ dx(1:ni/2,1:nj), dx(ni:-1:ni/2+1,nj-1:-1:1) ];
dy = [ dy([ni,1:ni/2],2:nj), dy(ni:-1:ni/2,nj:-1:2) ];

% æ›´æ–°ç»´åº¦ä¸ºæ—‹è½¬å
ni = size(dx,1);

æ–°çš„ç½‘æ ¼:

# Strain rate åº”å˜é€Ÿç‡ /deformation rate å˜å½¢é€Ÿç‡

æ ¹æ®è®ºæ–‡ä¸­çš„å®šä¹‰ï¼Œ
ux=1Aâˆ®udyu_x=\frac{1}{A}\oint u \text{d}yuxâ€‹=A1â€‹âˆ®udy,
uy=âˆ’1Aâˆ®udxu_y=-\frac{1}{A}\oint u \text{d}xuyâ€‹=âˆ’A1â€‹âˆ®udx,
vx=1Aâˆ®vdyv_x=\frac{1}{A}\oint v \text{d}yvxâ€‹=A1â€‹âˆ®vdy,
vy=âˆ’1Aâˆ®vdxv_y=-\frac{1}{A}\oint v \text{d}xvyâ€‹=âˆ’A1â€‹âˆ®vdx,

å‰ªåˆ‡ç‡ ÎµË™_shear=(uxâˆ’vy)2+(uy+vx)2\dot{\varepsilon}\_{\textrm{shear}}=\sqrt{\left ( u_{x}-v_{y}\right )^2+\left ( u_{y}+v_{x}\right )^2}ÎµË™_shear=(uxâ€‹âˆ’vyâ€‹)2+(uyâ€‹+vxâ€‹)2â€‹,
æ•£åº¦ç‡ $\dot\varepsilon }\_{\textrm {div}} = u\_x+v_y $, æ€»åº”å˜ç‡ $\dot {\varepsilon }\_{\textrm {tot}}=\sqrt {\dot {\varepsilon }\_{\textrm {shear}}ã€{2ã€‘+\dot\varepsilon }_{\textrm{div}}ã€{2ã€‘}$ã€‚

åœ¨æ•°å€¼è®¡ç®—ä¸­ï¼Œé¦–å…ˆçº¿æ€§æ’å€¼è®¡ç®—ç½‘æ ¼ä¸­ç‚¹çš„é€Ÿç‡ï¼ˆä¸dx,dydx,dydx,dy å¯¹åº”ï¼‰

uMidy = (u(:,1:nj)+u(:,2:nj+1))/2;
vMidx = (v(1:ni,:)+v(2:ni+1,:))/2;
uMidx = (u(1:ni,:)+u(2:ni+1,:))/2;
vMidy = (v(:,1:nj)+v(:,2:nj+1))/2;

å½“ç½‘æ ¼ç²—åŒ– times å€æ—¶ï¼ˆä»¥ 3 ä¸ºä¾‹ï¼‰ï¼Œç²—åŒ–åçš„ç½‘æ ¼å•å…ƒå³ä¸ºä¸Šå›¾ä¸­ç°è‰²çš„å•å…ƒã€‚

nx=fix(ni/times);  %ç²—åŒ–åç½‘æ ¼ä¸ªæ•°
ny=fix(nj/times);

nj=ny*times;

æ¯ä¸ªå¤§å•å…ƒçš„é€Ÿç‡åå¯¼çš„è®¡ç®—å…¬å¼ä¸º

A=âˆ‘i,j=13dxi,jdyi,j,A=\sum_{i,j=1}^{3}dx_{i,j}dy_{i,j},A=âˆ‘i,j=13â€‹dxi,jâ€‹dyi,jâ€‹,

uxâ‰ˆ1Aâˆ‘j=13((umidy4,jdy4,j)âˆ’(umidy1,jdy1,j)),u_x \approx \frac{1}{A} \sum_{j=1}^{3} \left ( \left ( u_{midy_{4,j}} dy_{4,j} \right ) - \left ( u_{midy_{1,j}} dy_{1,j} \right ) \right ),uxâ€‹â‰ˆA1â€‹âˆ‘j=13â€‹((umidy4,jâ€‹â€‹dy4,jâ€‹)âˆ’(umidy1,jâ€‹â€‹dy1,jâ€‹)),
vxâ‰ˆ1Aâˆ‘j=13((vmidy4,jdy4,j)âˆ’(vmidy1,jdy1,j)),v_x \approx \frac{1}{A} \sum_{j=1}^{3} \left ( \left ( v_{midy_{4,j}} dy_{4,j} \right ) - \left ( v_{midy_{1,j}} dy_{1,j} \right ) \right ),vxâ€‹â‰ˆA1â€‹âˆ‘j=13â€‹((vmidy4,jâ€‹â€‹dy4,jâ€‹)âˆ’(vmidy1,jâ€‹â€‹dy1,jâ€‹)),
vyâ‰ˆ1Aâˆ‘i=13((vmidxi,4dxi,4)âˆ’(vmidxi,1dxi,1)),v_y \approx \frac{1}{A} \sum_{i=1}^{3} \left ( \left ( v_{midx_{i,4}} dx_{i,4} \right ) - \left ( v_{midx_{i,1}} dx_{i,1} \right ) \right ),vyâ€‹â‰ˆA1â€‹âˆ‘i=13â€‹((vmidxi,4â€‹â€‹dxi,4â€‹)âˆ’(vmidxi,1â€‹â€‹dxi,1â€‹)),
uyâ‰ˆ1Aâˆ‘i=13((umidxi,4dxi,4)âˆ’(umidxi,1dxi,1)),u_y \approx \frac{1}{A} \sum_{i=1}^{3} \left ( \left ( u_{midx_{i,4}} dx_{i,4} \right ) - \left ( u_{midx_{i,1}} dx_{i,1} \right ) \right ),uyâ€‹â‰ˆA1â€‹âˆ‘i=13â€‹((umidxi,4â€‹â€‹dxi,4â€‹)âˆ’(umidxi,1â€‹â€‹dxi,1â€‹)),

å¯¹åº”ä»£ç ï¼š

%è®¡ç®—æ¯ä¸ªå¤§ç½‘æ ¼ç¬¬1ï¼štimesçš„ç›¸åº”æ•°å€¼
for i=1:times
    dxs(i,:,:)=dx(i:times:ni,1:times:nj);
    dxn(i,:,:) = dx(i:times:ni,1+times:times:nj+1);
    dye(i,:,:)=dy(1+times:times:ni+1,i:times:nj);
    dyw(i,:,:)=dy(times:times:ni,i:times:nj);
    ue(i,:,:) = uMidy(1+times:times:ni+1,i:times:nj);
    uw(i,:,:) = uMidy(times:times:ni,i:times:nj);
    ve(i,:,:) = vMidy(1+times:times:ni+1,i:times:nj);
    vw(i,:,:) = vMidy(times:times:ni,i:times:nj);
    vn(i,:,:) = vMidx(i:times:ni,1+times:times:nj+1);
    vs(i,:,:) = vMidx(i:times:ni,1:times:nj);
    un(i,:,:) = uMidx(i:times:ni,1+times:times:nj+1);
    us(i,:,:) = uMidx(i:times:ni,1:times:nj);
end
%ç´¯åŠ å°ç½‘æ ¼çš„è¿‘ä¼¼é¢ç§¯ä½œä¸ºå¤§ç½‘æ ¼çš„é¢ç§¯ï¼Œç»çº¬åæ ‡å–å¹³å‡
for i=1:times
    for j=1:times
        area=area+((dx(i:times:ni,j:times:nj)+dx(i:times:ni,1+j:times:nj+1))/2).*...
            ((dy(i+1:times:ni+1,j:times:nj)+dy(i:times:ni,j:times:nj))/2);
        latMid=latMid+lat(i:times:ni,j:times:nj);
        lonMid=lonMid+lon(i:times:ni,j:times:nj);
    end
end
latMid=latMid/(times^2);
lonMid=lonMid/(times^2);

ux = ( ue .* dye - uw .* dyw );
vy = ( vn .* dxn - vs .* dxs );
uy = ( un .* dxn - us .* dxs );
vx = ( ve .* dye - vw .* dyw );
ux=squeeze(sum(ux,1)) ./ area;
vy=squeeze(sum(vy,1)) ./ area;
uy=squeeze(sum(uy,1)) ./ area;
vx=squeeze(sum(vx,1)) ./ area;

å› æ­¤æœ€åå˜å½¢ç‡çš„è®¡ç®—ä¸ºï¼š

div = ux + vy;
%shr = abs(ux-vy);
shr = sqrt((ux-vy).^2+(uy+vx).^2);
tot = sqrt(shr.^2+div.^2);

# Strain rate åº”å˜é€Ÿç‡ /deformation rate å˜å½¢é€Ÿç‡

æ ¹æ®è®ºæ–‡ä¸­çš„å®šä¹‰ï¼Œ
ux=1Aâˆ®udyâ‰ˆ1Aâˆ‘i=1n12(ui+1+ui)(yi+1âˆ’yi)u_x=\frac{1}{A}\oint u \text{d}y \approx \frac{1}{A} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \frac{1}{2}\left ( u_{i+1}+u_i\right )\left ( y_{i+1}-y_i\right )uxâ€‹=A1â€‹âˆ®udyâ‰ˆA1â€‹âˆ‘i=1nâ€‹21â€‹(ui+1â€‹+uiâ€‹)(yi+1â€‹âˆ’yiâ€‹),
uy=âˆ’1Aâˆ®udxu_y=-\frac{1}{A}\oint u \text{d}xuyâ€‹=âˆ’A1â€‹âˆ®udx,
vx=1Aâˆ®vdyv_x=\frac{1}{A}\oint v \text{d}yvxâ€‹=A1â€‹âˆ®vdy,
vy=âˆ’1Aâˆ®vdxv_y=-\frac{1}{A}\oint v \text{d}xvyâ€‹=âˆ’A1â€‹âˆ®vdx,

å‰ªåˆ‡ç‡ ÎµË™shear=(uxâˆ’vy)2+(uy+vx)2\dot{\varepsilon}_{\textrm{shear}}=\sqrt{\left ( u_{x}-v_{y}\right )^2+\left ( u_{y}+v_{x}\right )^2}ÎµË™shearâ€‹=(uxâ€‹âˆ’vyâ€‹)2+(uyâ€‹+vxâ€‹)2â€‹,
æ•£åº¦ç‡ ÎµË™div=ux+vy\dot{\varepsilon }_{\textrm{div}} = u_x+v_yÎµË™divâ€‹=uxâ€‹+vyâ€‹,
æ€»åº”å˜ç‡ ÎµË™tot=ÎµË™shear2+ÎµË™div2\dot{\varepsilon }_{\textrm{tot}}=\sqrt{\dot{\varepsilon }_{\textrm{shear}}^{2}+\dot{\varepsilon }_{\textrm{div}}^{2}}ÎµË™totâ€‹=ÎµË™shear2â€‹+ÎµË™div2â€‹â€‹ã€‚

Strain rate is the rate of deformation caused by strain in a material within a corresponding time. This gauges the rate where distances of materials change within a respective period of time.

# B-grid

CSIM uses a generalized orthogonal B-grid, where tracer quantities are located at the center of the grid cells, and velocities are located at the corners. The internal ice stress tensor takes four different values within a grid cell. Tracer quantities in the ice model include ice and snow area, volume, energy and temperature. The grid comprised of the center points of the grid cells is referred to as the â€œT gridâ€. The â€œU gridâ€ is comprised of the ponts at the northeast corner of the corresponding cell on the T grid. Quantities that are defined on the U grid include ice and ocean dynamics variables.
